meanings.definition: Contrary to the teachings of scripture.
meanings.sent1: The preacher warned the congregation about the unscriptural beliefs spreading in the community.
meanings.sent2: It is unscriptural to ignore the moral guidelines set forth in the holy book.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pineapple being the king of fruits is as unscriptural as a cat wearing a crown.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were like an unscriptural storm, disrupting the peaceful teachings of the church.
meanings.sent5: The image of a rainbow at midnight is as unscriptural as the concept of a square circle.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with the principles of scripture.
meanings.sent1: The group's unscriptural decision to exclude certain members caused division among the believers.
meanings.sent2: Living a life that is unscriptural can lead one away from the path of righteousness.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a square peg into a round hole is as unscriptural as trying to make a fish climb a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her words were an unscriptural fire, burning down the foundation of trust built on biblical principles.
meanings.sent5: The unscriptural behavior of the characters in the story made it a cautionary tale of straying from faith.
